description:
Equipment:  
OTA: William Optics GT81 w/0.8x reducer (382mm fl at f/4.7)
Mount: Orion Sirius EQ-G (HEQ-5)
Guidescope: Orion 50mm guidescope
Guiding camera: Orion StarShoot Autoguider
Imaging camera: ZWO ASI1600MM-Cool

Software:  
SGP
PHD2
CdC
PixInsight

Acquisition:  
Location: Atoka, Oklahoma (Bortle 3)
Dates: 11/18/17, 11/21/17, 11/25/17
Gain: 76 Offset: 15
Camera temp: -20C
L: 107x180"
R: 30x180"
G: 32x180"
B: 25x180"
Total integration time: 9hr 42min
64x darks per calibration
30x flats per calibration
200x bias (master bias in library)  

Preprocessing:
Batch PreProcessing script to generate calibrated images
StarAlignment to register all frames to a reference L
LocalNormalization per channel
ImageIntegration
DrizzleIntegration
DynamicCrop each master
DBE on each master

RGB processing:
LinearFit to Blue channel
ChannelCombination to combine
PhotometricColorCalibration 
SCNR green
TGV and MMT noise reduction (via Jon Rista's method)
HistogramTransformation x3
CurvesTransformation w/starmask to saturate stars
CurvesTransformation with only nebula masked to saturate nebulosity
ColorSaturation tool to further saturate nebulosity
Slight HistogramTransformation
SCNR green

L processing:
TGV and MMT noise reduction (via Jon Rista's method)
HistogramTransformation
Duplicated the image to create a starless version, using a starmask and several iterations of MMT and MT. Then pushed the faint nebulosity in the starless version using PixelMath expression: "1-(1-$T)*(1-$T)"
Combined the starless version with the image using PixelMath expression "F=0.4; (1-(1-$T)*(1-s)*F)+($T*~F)" followed by the same function but with a value of F=0.2. (s=starless photo).
LocalHistogramEqualization with inverted starmask

Combined L and RGB with LRGBCombination tool
MorphologicalTransformation for slight star reduction
Resampled to 50% for web posting
title: Witch Head Nebula (IC 2118)
